item.title: PROGRESS ORDERS debut trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/progress-orders-debut-trailer

  • PC
  • Switch

Due out on April 10, 2025 in Japan.

Publisher Bushiroad Games and developer HAKAMA have released the debut trailer for PROGRESS ORDERS, their newly announced guild management fantasy RPG.

Here are the first details:

About (via)

After finding a letter that was left behind, the protagonist arrives at the guild “Legion” in search of traces of their grandfather.

Although their grandfather was nowhere to be found, the protagonist ends up working at the guild in exchange for help in gathering information.

During the guild staff initiation ceremony, the protagonist acquires the ability of “clairvoyance,” allowing them to see and hear through the eyes of others.

With their new ability, the protagonist strengthens their bonds with the guild staff and adventurers, supporting their adventures from behind the scenes and guiding their requests to success.

Over time, Legion’s reputation grows, attracting many skilled adventurer parties to register with the guild.

Characters

  • Protagonist (Male) (voiced by Shinsuke Sugawara) (via) – A young man who becomes a guild assistant through unforeseen circumstances. He is honest and has a calm personality. During the guild initiation ceremony, he acquires the ability of “clairvoyance,” allowing him to see and hear through the eyes of others. This special power eventually leads to a major incident that threatens the fate of the world.
  • Protagonist (Female) (voiced by Yukari Anzai) (via) – A young woman who becomes a guild assistant through unforeseen circumstances. She is honest and has a calm personality. During the guild initiation ceremony, she acquires the ability of “clairvoyance,” allowing her to see and hear through the eyes of others. This special power eventually leads to a major incident that threatens the fate of the world.

PROGRESS ORDERS is due out for Switch and PC via Steam on April 10, 2025 in Japan for 2,970 yen.

item.title: Emberstoria launches November 27 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/emberstoria-launches-november-27-in-japan

  • PC
  • Smartphone

Square Enix's new free-to-play strategy RPG dated.

Free-to-play strategy RPG Emberstoria will launch for iOS via App Store, Android via Google Play, and PC via DMM Games Player on November 27 in Japan, Square Enix announced.

Here is an overview of the game:

About

Purgatory—a land infested with monsters, a place where the wisdom of numerous lost worlds sleeps.

Humanity, harnessing this buried knowledge and the technology it reclaimed from the ashes, built enormous ships that soar through the skies and revived the souls smoldering in the depths of the earth as fearless warriors.

All to survive in this harsh world.

Key Features

  • Conquest: Fight Alongside Allies – Analyze the battlefield in real-time and conquer the tower at the center of the world. Battle against enemy forces, defeat magical beasts, and take on the trials of Purgatory with your allies.
  • City Development: Build a Base – The key to victory is developing Anima Arca, the floating city that acts as your base. Strengthen your base through construction, research, training, and resource production. You can customize the base’s layout to your liking.
  • Training: Embers, the Pillars of Your Army – Form contracts and fight alongside Embers, otherworldly warriors summoned from hell. Embers can be trained using items obtained by defeating magical beasts. Weapons and armor crafted from magical beast materials will also become a powerful asset in battle.
  • Story: Decipher the World – A story about changing destiny, woven together by a cast of over 40 wonderful voice actors. The main story is fully voiced, and features Live2D during character dialogue.

Staff

  • Main Character Design: Yusuke Kozaki (Fire Emblem Awakening, Fire Emblem if, Pokemon GO)
  • Composer: Masashi Hamauzu (Final Fantasy XIII, SaGa Frontier 2)
  • Main Scenario: Benny Matsuyama (Fuse’s story in SaGa Frontier Remastered, Imperial SaGa)
  • Voice Cast: Minami Takahashi, Ayana Taketatsu, Aya Endo, Kensho Ono, Yuichi Nakamura, Mariya Ise, Koki Uchiyama, and more…
